200301.n: Exploring the City: Urban Spaces and Cultures

200401.n: Exploring the City: Urban Spaces and Cultures

200501.n: Exploring the City: Urban Spaces and Cultures

catList: How do we begin to understand the differences, commonalities, and interconnections between 'World Cities' - such as Cairo, New York, Istanbul or Singapore?  This course will provide a critical guide to the diverse ideas, concepts and frameworks used to study such cities.  It will explore how city spaces and cultures are constituted, divided and contested, by focusing such topics as:  colonial landscapes of power and exclusion, modernist projects of urban renewal and dislocation,  'post-modern' spaces of spectacle and consumption,  ghettoes of affluence and poverty, ethnic divisions of labor and informal economies behind the facades of the global capital.
